title: Manually Adding a new program
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the ballpark guide
And the user has not already added the program for that ballpark
custom_expected: Then the user will be taken to the onboarding process for programs

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the 'Club Members' button in the grid
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the user will be taken to the onboarding process for programs
(Boston one you need to do through desktop before hand, so check on San Diego Padres)

title: Displaying an eCash balance
custom_preconds:
Given the account we are logged into is part of a program
And the account has an amount of eCash added to it
custom_expected: Then we will see the balance displayed correctly

custom_steps_separated.content:
When we look on the program view
And we look on the scan view
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user will see the account balance under "balance"

title: Displaying a 0 eCash balance
custom_preconds:
Given the account we are logged into is part of a program
And the account has 0 eCash
custom_expected:
Then we will see the 0 balance displayed correctly($0.00)

Account: wasfortress2@mlb.com baseball

custom_steps_separated.content:
When we look on the program view
And we look on the scan view
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user will see the account balance as $0.00

title: Displaying a loyalty balance
custom_preconds:
Given the account we are logged into is part of a program
And the account has an amount of loyalty added to it
custom_expected: Then we will see the balance displayed correctly

custom_steps_separated.content:
When we look on the program view
And we look on the scan view
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user will see balance under the "balance"

title: Displaying a 0 loyalty balance
custom_preconds:
Given the account we are logged into is part of a program
And the account has 0 loyalty

Account: wasfortress1@mlb.com
custom_expected: Then we will see the 0 balance displayed correctly

custom_steps_separated.content:
When we look on the program view
And we look on the scan view
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user will see the balance display $0.00

title: UniPass Program View
custom_preconds: Given the user has navigated to their program page
custom_expected:
Then the user will see there personal information at the top
And the Event Information for the next event available or current active event will be below that
And below that there will be a link saying 'View home team Park Guide' 
And there will be a section with the user's cards available for entry today
And there will be a section for other cards in your account that are not applicable to today's event
And there will be a Services section with different options (Options under services vary with different clubs)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the content loads
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the user should view open up
And the view should contain the following
- account information
- barcode
- seating information
- last updated(timestamp)
- if the ticket has been scanned for entry

title: UniPass - Displaying your game card
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the UniPass program page
custom_expected:
Then a modal will open
And the modal will contain Event Information
And the barcode for the seat
And the user's membership information
And there will be an 'X' to close the modal in the top left corner
And the user will see a page indicator at the bottom if multiple cards are present

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on an available card
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user will the card information

title: Navigating through multiple cards (UniPass)
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on their UniPass Program View
And the user has multiple cards
And the user has tapped on a card (seat)
And the UniPass Scan modal has opened
custom_expected:
Then the modal will switch between cards
And the page indicator at the bottom will update accordingly

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user swipes to the left or right
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user should be able to scroll through each unipass

title: Confirm time is localized on Program and Scan views
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the program view
Or the user is on the scan view
custom_expected: Then the time will be localized to match the timezone of the event stadium's timezone(i.e. Washington=EST, BOS=EST, SD=PST)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user looks at the event information
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see the time is set to the the ballpark's timezone

title: Scan View - Auto Brightness
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the Program View
custom_expected:
Then the scan view modal will open
And the device's brightness will automatically be boosted to full

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on a "card"
custom_steps_separated.expected: Brightness will max out on tap of scan view

title: Scan View - No available for entry
custom_preconds: Given the user has passes in their Program View that are listed in the 'Other passes in your account' section
custom_expected:
Then the user will be taken to the Scan View
And the user will see an icon with a ticket and circle around the ticket with a diagonal line going through it. Next to that icon you will a message stating 'Not valid for entry'

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on one of these passes
custom_steps_separated.expected: the pass will display the not available for entry at the bottom of the scan view

title: Confirm seating info is mapping correctly on Program and Scan views
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the Program View
Or the user is on the Scan View
custom_expected:
Then the data will be displayed correctly
And the data will match in both views

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user looks at the seating info
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should see the section, row, and seat on the scan view

title: Seats Webview
custom_preconds: Given the user is on a Multi/UniPass Program View
custom_expected: Then the user will be taken to the Manage Seats webview

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user taps on the Manage Seats button in the Services section

*Note
Manage Seats is available for WAS and SD
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be directed to the manage seats webview

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the Help button in the Services section

custom_expected: Then the user will be taken to the Privacy Policy webview

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the Privacy Policy button in the Services section
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user will be taken to the PP webview

title: Program View - Having 20 passes or more
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on their Program View
And the user has > 20 passes linked to their account
custom_expected:
Then the user will see messaging after the first 20 passes are displayed
And the messaging will read, 'First twenty passes displayed; only twenty passes supported per account.'

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user scrolls down on the Program View
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the user should see the first 20 passes
and the user will see only 20 passes supported(might not be for android, but so far none of the accounts are working for me)

title: Program View - View home team Park Guide link
custom_preconds: Given the user has navigated to their program page
custom_expected: Then the ballpark guide of the hometeam stadium will come in from top to bottom

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user clicks on the 'View hometeam Park Guide link located below the Event section
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the ballpark guide of the hometeam stadium will come in from top to bottom

title: Program View - Services section
custom_preconds: Given the user has navigated to their program page
custom_expected:
A modal for that service will open from down to up to the correct web view with the title of that service on top of the page 
And clicking 'Done' will take you back to the program page.

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user scrolls down to the Services section and taps on one of the services

*Do this for each service button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the user will see the service section
And the section will populate menu items depending on what is supported

title: Confirm time is localized on Program and Scan views
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the program view
Or the user is on the scan view
custom_expected:
Then the time will be localized to match the timezone of the device
(check for all US timezones)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user looks at the event information
custom_steps_separated.expected: the time should be localized to the ballpark's timezone

title: Multipass Program View
custom_preconds: Given the user has navigated to their program page
custom_expected:
Then the user will see their plan information at the top
And the user will be able to tap their information to display their barcode
And below will be the Event Information
And there will be a Check In button if the game is in a pre/live state
And there will be a section containing the users seat information
And there will be a Services section with different options (manage seats, manage eCash, Loyalty rewards, help, and privacy policy)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the content loads
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be on the program view
And the user will see the account information
